# San-Francisco-Air-Cargo-Data-Analysis---Python

*Note: This assignment is a part of submissions for Udacity Data Scientist NanoDegree Program.*

 **

## Overview

---

Over the last couple of decades, the air cargo industry has contributed significantly in transforming the supply chain networks across the world. It has played a pivotal role in facilitating access to new markets and the subsequent development of economies. Due to an increase in demand for faster delivery, technological advancements in cargo-tracking status, and hassle-free cross-border e-commerce processes, the air cargo industry is projected to grow at a [CAGR of 4.0% during 2021â€“2027](https://www.prnewswire.com/in/news-releases/air-cargo-market-to-reach-usd-111810-million-by-2027-at-a-cagr-of-4-valuates-reports-850656167.html).

**The objective of this article, therefore, is to analyze the air cargo operations data collected for San Francisco International Airport (SFO), California, USA,** and answer some questions to better understand the trends of air cargo movement through this international airport. San Francisco International Airport is the largest airport in San Francisco Bay Area, [the 7th busiest airport](https://www.worldatlas.com/articles/busiest-airports-in-united-states.html) in the US (by passenger count), and features in [the top 30 cargo airports](https://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/passenger_allcargo_stats/passenger/media/cy17-cargo-airports.pdf) in US.

## Data Source and code details

---

The **dataset** used for this project is sourced from [Kaggle: San Francisco Air Cargo Statistics](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/vivovinco/san-francisco-air-traffic-cargo-statistics)

The **data dictionary** can be accessed here: [DataSF Data Dictionary for Air Traffic Cargo Statistics](https://data.sfgov.org/api/views/u397-j8nr/files/c4eebc3d-88e2-4647-9c56-b3a8f60473f7?download=true&filename=DataSF%20Data%20Dictionary%20for%20Air%20Traffic%20CARGO%20Statistics.pdf) 

**Type**: Jupyter Notebook

**Language**: Python

**Note**: This dataset does not contain details about the revenue generated through any of the shipments taking off or landing at SFO, but only about the weights of the shipments in pounds and Metric Tons. Therefore, the analysis on exports and imports is done taking weights on consideration, with an assumption that higher weights of shipments would entail higher revenue, compared to lower weights.

**Libraries Used:** Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib

**Kaggle Notebook Link:** [https://www.kaggle.com/prajita/nb-san-francisco-air-cargo-traffic-analysis](https://www.kaggle.com/prajita/nb-san-francisco-air-cargo-traffic-analysis)

---

- Section A: Data Understanding
- Section B: Data Preparation

    - [Q - C2: Discuss the import and export trends from every region over the years via SFO](https://kkb-production.jupyter-proxy.kaggle.net/static/dist/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-index-d7b4e7f67d699acabc2e.html?session=eyJhbGciOiJub25lIiwidHlwIjoiSldUIn0..#section-c2)
    - [Q - C3: Which airlines plied the largest amount of cargo through the SFO in last five years?](https://kkb-production.jupyter-proxy.kaggle.net/static/dist/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-index-d7b4e7f67d699acabc2e.html?session=eyJhbGciOiJub25lIiwidHlwIjoiSldUIn0..#section-c3)
